course.title: History at the Movies
course.description: Since the earliest days of cinema, filmmakers have looked to the past for inspiration. Historians have often dismissed cinematic versions of the past for their inaccuracies and simplications. This seminar adopts a more open-minded view of historical movies to explore the potential of film as a medium for understanding and representing history and to consider some of the "big" questions of history. Movies covering a wide chronological range and drawn from a variety of sub-genres will be included. ?
